text:
Hi guys, when I deploy the project on HS I get this error on console:
`âœ– Failed to upload tag-website-project project files to dev (xxxxxxxx)`
`[ERROR] The post in account (portal_id) was bad. Platform version is missing from your project configuration. Please add the platformVersion field to the hsproject.json file, then try uploading the project again. Available versions: [2023.2].`

In my `hsproject.json` file I have this configuration:
``` {
  "name": "tag-website-project",
  "srcDir": ".",
  "platformVersion": "2023.2"
}```
It was working until yesterday.
What am I doing wrong? Can you help me out?
I have the same hsproject.json configuration. portalId is defined in HubSpot.config.yml file. Maybe you could re-authenticate your HubSpot portal
I also tried deploying to a new portal and I get the same error
What version of the CLI are you using?
You're going to need to update to the latest version ... which is `5.2.0`
<@UAYBXDG4U> yes it was that, thanks a lot :pray:
Hey, is it possible to access the graphql schema url in the IDE to for example generate typings for queries or just develop them locally?
hi y'all! i've noticed some discrepancies with `ColorField` - sometimes the data returns an object with `color` `hex` `opacity` etc. and sometimes it is returning a string.

additionally, do certain apps get cached or need time to update? because i've deployed our latest code to our main staging theme/app and it doesn't seem to be updating with the latest, but i'm seeing the new updates on my personal development theme/app.
these are also the two apps i mention in my latest message, the app that returns a string vs. an object is the one that isn't updating, if that gives appropriate context
